required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Median Nerve Strain and Applied Pressure Measurement in the Carpal Tunnel Syndrome Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Median Nerve Strain and Applied Pressure Measurement in the Carpal Tunnel Syndrome Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate diagnostic accuracy of median nerve strain and applied pressure measurement . Idiopathic carpal tunnel syndrome patients and healthy controls will be evaluated by ultrasound. Median nerve strain, pressure applied to the skin will be measured at the proximal part of the carpal tunnel. The parameters will be compared between patients and controls, and before and after the open carpal tunnel release in the patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate diagnostic accuracy of median nerve strain and applied pressure measurement . Idiopathic carpal tunnel syndrome patients and healthy controls will be evaluated by ultrasound. Median nerve strain, pressure applied to the skin, and ratio of pressure-strain will be measured at the proximal part of the carpal tunnel. In addition, distal latencies in the motor and sensory nerve conductions studies and cross-sectional area of median nerve will be measured. The parameters will be compared between patients and controls, and before and after the open carpal tunnel release in the patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Change of the median nerve strain from the initial measurement at 3, 6, 12 months after the treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Change of the applied pressure from the inital measurement at 3, 6, 12months after the treatment

arm_group.description: group of carpal tunnel syndrome patients

intervention.description: Measurement of median nerve strain and applied pressure at proximal carpal tunnel level

study_pop.textblock: carpal tunnel syndrome patients and asymptomatic control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- carpal tunnel syndrome patients and asymptomatic control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded if there was a history of cervical radiculopathy, rheumatoid arthritis, gout, hemodialysis, sarcoidosis, amyloidosis, or traumatic injuries to the arm. Written consent was obtained from all study participants

overall_official.affiliation: Tokyo Medical University Ibaraki Medical Center

facility.name: Tokyo Medical University Ibaraki Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor, Department of Orthopaedic Surgery
